definition: abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards

sentences.english: Thank you North Korea. This might start WW3.
sentences.chinese: 感謝北朝鮮，這可能會引發第三次世界大戰。

sentences.english: North Korea is not going to start bombing anybody.
sentences.chinese: 北朝鮮沒有核打擊任何國家的想法。

sentences.english: You can forget about China ever allying with US against North Korea.
sentences.chinese: 如果美國支持臺灣，中國就會支持北朝鮮。

sentences.english: North Korea threatened to shoot at the speakers earlier this year.
sentences.chinese: 北朝鮮今年早些時候威脅要射殺這些喊話者。

sentences.english: North Korean commandos are not expected to survive such attacks.
sentences.chinese: 此類攻擊後，北朝鮮突擊隊預計不會有人活着。

sentences.english: Albania was on the verge of turning into another Cuba or North Korea.
sentences.chinese: 阿爾巴尼亞處於轉變成另一個古巴或北朝鮮的邊緣。

sentences.english: And North Korea hovers as a relentless threat.
sentences.chinese: 北朝鮮則徘徊附近的持續威脅。

sentences.english: Millions of North Koreans have gone hungry in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 數百萬北朝鮮人在近幾年來已經捱過餓。

sentences.english: North Korea is a bully and needs a regime change.
sentences.chinese: 北朝鮮是個小霸王，他們的制度該修理了。

sentences.english: North Korea has threatened to launch another long-range missile.
sentences.chinese: 北朝鮮威脅說將還將會發射遠程導彈。

sentences.english: North Koreans work in the fields near Panmunjom in the demilitarized zone.
sentences.chinese: 在非軍事區板門店附近，北朝鮮人在田裏幹活兒。

sentences.english: North Korea has much to do about nothing. In a week we are going to forget about it.
sentences.chinese: 北朝鮮大題小做，要不了多久我們就會忘記這件事了。

sentences.english: The North conducted a nuclear test in October.
sentences.chinese: 去年十月，北朝鮮進行了覈實驗。

sentences.english: Odds are much better that a little nut-job country like NK would use them.
sentences.chinese: 像北朝鮮這種彈丸小國使用核武器的話，成本小多了。

sentences.english: The early Great Wall was located much further north than the current Ming wall, with its eastern end at modern day North Korea.
sentences.chinese: 在早期的長城比明牆還要往北，東端在現在的北朝鮮。

sentences.english: These refugees had to be fed and housed in the South. A few thousand crossed over from South to North.
sentences.chinese: 於此同時也有幾千人從南朝鮮逃到北朝鮮。

definition: North Korea/Korea as geographic term/Taiwan pr. [Chao2 xian1]
Diaoyu Islands, claimed by China but controlled by Japan as the Senkaku Islands, also called the Pinnacle Islands
to garrison/to stand guard/on garrison duty
prisoner of war/to capture/to take prisoner/(old) northern barbarian/slave
to wait to fill a vacancy/reserve (candidate)/alternate/substitute
foreign ministry (e.g. of Japan or Korea)
to regulate/rules and regulations/regulatory/style and structure (esp. of building)
